Text:
See? Stop motion animation doesn't suffer as much from low bitrates as live action does, so this release is actually quite acceptable.

I still think the choice is either 1) to go with a constant quality method, or 2) to tailor the bitrate to the nature (live vs animated) of the show being encoded. One size does not fit all.

I mean, that's pretty basic: https://trac.handbrake.fr/wiki/AvgBitrateAndTargetSize

Are you familiar with the term "noodge"?

AVIGUY
